attributes.action: Refund to all Fans from the Premier League/Clubs who bought PPV Games.
attributes.additional_details: This is a decision that's been made, based on clubs needing revenue as fans aren't in the stadium yet, Premier League clubs have splashed around £1.4billion on permanent signings during the recent summer transfer window. Even though some fans are still paying Direct Debits for a season ticket, they are now being told they will have to spend £15 on each individual game that is not televised. This issue needs highlighting and talked about.
attributes.background: The decision this week by the Premier League/Clubs, to charge fans for PPV games at £14.95 during this pandemic could arguably be one of the lowest points in Modern Football. The Premier League/Clubs who voted in favour of this decision should be held accountable to ensure a refund goes to fans.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for broadcasters and the football authorities.
